meanings.definition: Showing contempt or scorn by curling the upper lip.
meanings.sent1: The bully's sneerier look made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She gave a sneerier smile when she heard the news.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a sneerier expression when it saw the dog trying to catch its tail.
meanings.sent4: His sneerier attitude towards authority figures was evident in his rebellious actions.
meanings.sent5: The sneerier expression on her face made it clear she was not impressed.

meanings.definition: Having a mocking or scornful expression.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's sneerier face added to his sarcastic jokes.
meanings.sent2: She shot him a sneerier glance after his rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The sneerier look on his face made it hard to take him seriously.
meanings.sent4: Her sneerier smile revealed her true feelings about the situation.
meanings.sent5: The sneerier expression on his face showed his disapproval clearly.

meanings.definition: More sneering in attitude or expression than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: His sneerier tone of voice made it clear he was not happy.
meanings.sent2: The sneerier look on her face showed her disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The sneerier expression on his face made it obvious he was not impressed.
meanings.sent4: The sneerier attitude of the group made others feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent5: Her sneerier response indicated her annoyance with the situation.
